instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165A: What is 820-00165A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook AIR <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> turns off intermittently (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message: I have changed the battery, it stays on for a while longer now but still just blacks out/Turns Off  randomly, can anyone help?

threads.title: Macbook AIR <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> turns off intermittently (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Any history fault available?
Inspect board for corrosion.
Start in SMC bypass and see if still turns off in the same manner.

threads.title: Macbook AIR <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> turns off intermittently (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 78660, member: 682"]
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Any history fault available?
Inspect board for corrosion.
Start in SMC bypass and see if still turns off in the same manner.
[/QUOTE]
Hi, thank you
the board is clean, there's no corrosion at all. I still cleaned every component.
I am sorry but what does SMC bypass mean?
like how do I bypass it?

threads.title: Macbook AIR <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> turns off intermittently (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message:
We have a lot of basic information on the forum.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]
Many times can solve a problem just searching and reading more threads possible.

Don't forget to test with original Magsafe 2 charger; other than the actual used.

Do not quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.
Do not click Reply button, write directly into bottom reply box.
Please, maintain forum aesthetic...

threads.title: Macbook AIR <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> turns off intermittently (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)
threads.message: Thanks @ 2informaticos, I am gonna try bypassing the SMC today
